title: Textile With Factory Stamp, 1762–83
medium:
Medium: cotton
Technique: pinted by engraved plate on plain weave
inscribed: Factory stamp at one end bearing the mark of the Oberkampf manufactory in use between 1762 and 1783. Also the printed initials 'EB' enclosed in a box. (initials od one of the workers). Also 'D55' (standing for Design Number 55) handwritten in red ink.
provenance: Formerly owned by Elinor Merrell where it was No. 8 on her list of chefs de piece.
dimensions:
H x W: 233.7 x 55.2 cm (7 ft. 8 in. x 21 3/4 in.)
Repeat H: 102.2 cm (40 1/4 in.)
description: 'Chinoiserie' design of people in gardens with buildings and birds. Red on white background.

tombstone.epitaph:
Textile With Factory Stamp, 1762–83.
1762–83. Medium: cotton
Technique: pinted by engraved plate on plain weave. Gift of Cora Ginsburg. 1994-80-4.
